meanings.definition: To put in danger or at risk.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked could jeopard our safety.
meanings.sent2: Speeding on the highway may jeopard your life.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting your umbrella might jeopard your dry clothes.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs can jeopard your future success.
meanings.sent5: Not wearing a helmet while biking could jeopard your head's safety.

meanings.sent1: Entering the abandoned building is a great jeopard.
meanings.sent2: Swimming in rough waters poses a serious jeopard.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food can be a delicious jeopard for some.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest was a looming jeopard to the lost hikers.
meanings.sent5: The unstable bridge was a visible jeopard to the travelers.
